speaker: joaomoreno
text: ⚠️🚧👷 Scheduled rename `master` branch to `main` On **Feb 14, 2021, 8PM UTC** the `microsoft/vscode` repository will rename its `master` branch to `main`.  cc @microsoft/vscode  ---  ⚠️ **Call to Action** ⚠️  If you have a clone of `microsoft/vscode` locally, you'll need to run the following commands **_after_** the rename happens:  ``` git branch -m master main git fetch origin git branch -u origin/main main git fetch --prune ```

speaker: baslr
text: Women can also be a construction worker 👷‍♀️ 🤦‍♀️

speaker: joaomoreno
solarblueberry
text: May I ask why is this necessary? Did I miss something?

speaker: foreignmeloman
text:
> May I ask why is this necessary? Did I miss something?

I guess the same reason why GitHub defaults to 'main' master branch name now. Good old PC BS. Apparently word 'master' has a bad stigma attached to it now 🤦‍♂️

speaker: joaomoreno
text:
Guys & gals, I'm sorry. Nothing bad happened here, but I'm just going to lock this thread right now before it does.

As a team, we've decided to go ahead with this rename, because reasons. This issue isn't the place to discuss the merits and drawbacks of the rename. If you feel like venting, I recommend you do so through your own personal mechanisms. Mine is running 10k out in the cold. 🏃
